search_range|search_result_array.name: search_range|search_result_array
search_range|search_result_array.detail: One method of using this function is to provide a single sorted row or column `search_range` to look through for the `search_key` with a second argument `result_range`. The other way is to combine these two arguments into one `search_result_array` where the first row or column is searched and a value is returned from the last row or column in the array. If `search_key` is not found, a non-exact match may be returned.

result_range.name: result_range
result_range.detail: The range from which to return a result. The value returned corresponds to the location where `search_key` is found in `search_range`. This range must be only a single row or column and should not be used if using the `search_result_array` method.

Date.name: Date

Reversion and exclusion.name: Reversion and exclusion

ISDATE.description: Whether a value is a date.

value.name: value
value.detail: The value to be verified as a date.

Range.name: Range
Range.detail: RangeValues can be calculated effectively, such as A1:A20, {1,2,3,4,5}, etc.

Line color.name: Line color
Line color.detail: The line color of the line graph can be range A1, color table index value or specific color value. Set it to 0 or false to not display it. It supports regx, rgb, rgba, etc. Default #2ec7c9

Line thickness.name: Line thickness
Line thickness.detail: Line thickness of the line graph, the default is 1px

Auxiliary line.name: Auxiliary line
Auxiliary line.detail: A horizontal line, which can be min, max, avg, median, range or custom value, default 0 none

Auxiliary line color.name: Auxiliary line color
Auxiliary line color.detail: Color setting of auxiliary line, same as line color configuration, default #000

Maximum mark.name: Maximum mark
Maximum mark.detail: Identifies the maximum value of the line graph, the same line color configuration, default 0 does not display

Minimum mark.name: Minimum mark
Minimum mark.detail: Identify the minimum value of the line graph, the same line color configuration, default 0 does not display

Mark size.name: Mark size
Mark size.detail: The maximum and minimum mark size settings, the default is 1.5

Range.detail: RangeValues can be calculated effectively, such as A1:A20, {1,2,3,4,5}, etc.

Stack by column.name: Stack by column
Stack by column.detail: If you need to stack by row, set this item to false or 0, the default is 1

Bar interval.name: Bar interval
Bar interval.detail: The distance between bars, the default is 1

Max.name: Max
Max.detail: The maximum value of the cumulative bar, used to regulate the length of the bar, the default is to automatically calculate false, auto, null

Color palette.name: Color palette
Color palette.detail: The color palette can individually set the bar color of each dimension, which can be set to the range of A1:A10, etc. The default is #2ec7c9, #fc5c5c, #5ab1ef, #ffb980...

Segmentation threshold.detail: Discrete graph column color distinction, for example: if the value is 0, blue is greater than 0, red is less than 0, and the default is 0

Above threshold color.name: Above threshold color

Below threshold color.name: Below threshold color
Below threshold color.detail: The color setting of the bar below the threshold, the same as the color above the threshold, default #fc5c5c

Negative bar color.name: Negative bar color
Negative bar color.detail: Negative bar color setting, representing the color of negative value, same as the bar color configuration, default #97b552

Zero value bar color.name: Zero value bar color
Zero value bar color.detail: Zero value bar color setting, representing 0 value color, the same color configuration of the bar, default #999

Color palette.name: Color palette
Color palette.detail: The color palette can set the color of each bar individually, multiple settings can be set, and two formats are supported: 1 color such as #000, which means that the color of the first bar is black; 2 value range: color, such as -2:# 000 indicates that the bar with a value of -2 is black, 0:5:#000 indicates that the bar with a value of 0-5 is black, and the default is empty

config.name: config

SORT.description: Sorts rows of range by specified column.

sort_column.name: sort_column
sort_column.detail: The index of the column in `range` or a range outside of `range` containing the values by which to sort.

is_ascending.name: is_ascending
is_ascending.detail: `TRUE` or `FALSE` indicating whether to sort `sort_column` in ascending order. `FALSE` sorts in descending order.

FILTER.description: Filters a range based off provided conditions.

condition1.name: condition1
condition1.detail: A column or row containing true or false values corresponding to the first column or row of `range`, or an array formula evaluating to true or false.

condition2.name: condition2
condition2.detail: Additional rows or columns containing boolean values `TRUE` or `FALSE` indicating whether the corresponding row or column in `range` should pass through `FILTER`. Can also contain array formula expressions which evaluate to such rows or columns. All conditions must be of the same type (row or column). Mixing row conditions and column conditions is not permitted.

UNIQUE.description: Unique rows in the provided source range.

range.name: range
range.detail: The data to filter by unique entries.

by_col.name: by_col
by_col.detail: [Option] - Logical value, indicating how to compare; by row = FALSE() or omitted; by column = TRUE().

occurs_once.name: occurs_once
occurs_once.detail: [Option] - Logical value, only one occurrence in the unique value is returned = TRUE(); including all unique values = FALSE() or omitted.

RANDARRAY.description: Returns a grid of random numbers.

rows.name: rows
rows.detail: The number of rows to populate with a random number.

columns.name: columns
columns.detail: The number of columns to populate with a random number.

SEQUENCE.description: Returns a grid of sequential numbers.

rows.name: rows
rows.detail: The number of rows in the function's resulting grid.

columns.name: columns
columns.detail: The number of columns in the function's resulting grid. If omitted, the result grid will have 1 column.

start.name: start
start.detail: The number, at which to start the sequence. If omitted, the sequence will start at 1.

step.name: step
step.detail: The amount each value in the sequence will differ by. If omitted, each value will differ by 1.

EVALUATE.description: Evaluate according to literal formula or expression.

REMOTE.description: Calls a function on a remote back end server/API.
